Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2016 04:46PM Yogalady333 wrote: I am in one of these situations where the 3D screening mammogram of my left breast where I originally had breast cancer was suspicious. Followup diagnostic mammography and ultrasound also suspicious. My oncologist who is highly experienced does not think it is cancer. He ordered a breast MRI before just automatically having me proceed to a core biopsy. That came out "highly suspicious for malignancy." The oncologist still thinks it is not cancer but possibly fatty necrosis. The suspicious area is adjacent to the original surgery lumpectomy scar from almost five years ago. There has been no trauma recently so wondering why something new would appear in that area. I am not keen about having a core biopsy--would rather have a single needle biopsy or watchful waiting. Has anyone been in a similar situation?
Posts.Title: Scar tissue look like cancer on ultrasound? michellesharii LMS

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2016 04:48PM Yogalady333 wrote: To GranM-- Was it the core biopsy that caused all the bleeding and a hemotoma?
Posts.Title: Scar tissue look like cancer on ultrasound? michellesharii LMS
